alert.note: Alert for Wake (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 10 at 5:12PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Wake County through 545 PM EDT... At 511 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Garner, or near Raleigh, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Raleigh, Garner, Knightdale, Wendell and Lake Benson. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Very heavy rain can be expected due to the slow movement of this storm. Prolonged heavy rain will result in ponding of water on roadways, standing water in low lying areas, and minor flooding of creeks and streams. Drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid hydroplaning.
